fields.description:
When we try to access one particular review we get the following error...

500 error
javax.servlet.ServletException
javax.el.ELException: java.lang.NullPointerException

This is reproducible every time and this review is the only review in the project displaying this behaviour. All other reviews are fine.

We have already tried...

* Re-index Crucible Data
* Re-index Repository

Here's the larger dump...

javax.el.ELException: java.lang.NullPointerException

fields.summary: Error when viewing a certain review

fields.description: The Crucible project stats page allows me to see stats over Draft/Open/Closed/All, but it would be extremely useful to have other filters that could be searched on. In particular, by individual would be very helpful so that programming leads could look at reports on individual programmers.

As a user is creating a review inside Crucible, the drop down box (field with label "Repository") under the tab "Manage Files" is listing all repositories. These include both repositories that accessible to current user and not available. 

A Crucible System with more than 1000+ repositories has created some difficulties for the user (who only able to access few repositories each) to select. The desired result is to show only those repositories which are accessible to current user.
fields.summary: Hide Repositories (unavailable to current user) in Repository drop down box

fields.description:
In Crucible review, if I send email review to built-in user (without defined email address) will prompt correct error message. To reproduce, follow steps below: 
# Select one existing review.
# Click on "Email Review" button.
# Enter a recipient (built-in user) who has blank email value in the user record.
# Click "Send" button.
# The exception is "javax.mail.SendFailedException - No recipient addresses" on the same screen.

But if we choose to send to LDAP user with similar situation, NPE is being thrown.
# Select one existing review.
# Click on "Email Review" button.
# Enter a recipient (LDAP user) who has blank email value in the user record.
# Click "Send" button.
# The exception is "javax.lang.NullPointerException" on the another screen with "500 Server Error".
fields.summary: Send email review to LDAP user (without defined email address) creates NullPointerException

fields.description:
We are trying to use Crucible (And have FishEye and Jira installed and integrated together).  In many cases, we want to have reviews performed before the checkin is committed.  The patch feature works for this, however, the patch files do not show all the source.

There is a painful workaround:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/2.1.7+Creating+a+Patch+Review
whereby the user tells the diff util to add ALL the lines of the file to the patch.  This makes it very painful for the users and many don't do it.

THe result is that people try to review the patch without much context (just a few lines around the changed code.)

Since we have fisheye and crucible can talk to fisheye, it would make sense for it to just be able to apply that patch to the correct revision as retrieved from FishEye.  

We are having a hard time getting users to actually use Crucible because of this.
fields.summary: Patches should allow for specification of source in FishEye

fields.description:
ContentUrl returned on:
AtlasEye -> atlaseye/cru/CR-PL-6/rawcontent/115730//svn/PL/trunk/atlassian-intellij-connector/src/main/java/com/atlassian/theplugin/idea/crucible/LineCommentTooltipPanel.java (based on https://svn.atlassin.com) - server url
AtlasEyeQA -> /cru/CR-ACC-3/rawcontent/115065/%2Fsvn%2FACC%2Ftrunk%2Fcom.atlassian.connector.commons%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2Fjava%2Fcom%2Fatlassian%2Ftheplugin%2Fcommons%2Fcrucible%2Fapi%2Fmodel%2FCustomFieldBean.java ( based on https://atlaseye-qa.atlassian.com/atlaseye) - application url

Atlaseye API url -> https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/rest-service/reviews-v1/CR-PL-6/details
Atlaseye-qa API url -> https://atlaseye-qa.atlassian.com/atlaseye/rest-service/reviews-v1/CR-ACC-3/details

Contents url should be application based (as Atlaseye-qa)?
fields.summary: ContentUrl returned by REST API should be releative to application url

fields.description:
Need to refactor what gets reloaded when changing the slider so that the slider doesn't get reloaded.

This is a little tricky because of the position of the slider in the page, since things above and below it in the DOM tree need to be reloaded with info from the new toRev.
fields.summary: keep slider visible during frx reload

fields.description: add own drafts to "Add to review" suggestions
fields.summary: Let the review suggestions include your own drafts

fields.description: it should only be visible if FishEye is available
fields.summary: Repository List is visible when using Crucible-only

fields.description: Files are showing up constantly as binary when creating a review and select files from LightSVN plugin repository. This happens when the file is without file extension. For example, see the attached screen shots. The file named "p4Settings" is a text file without file extension, see the file details in Fisheye [here|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/30790/textFile.png].
fields.summary: Files with no extension show up as Binary when using LightSVN plugin

fields.description: because we get the blame directly from the source control, and we calculate diffs ourselves, when you combine the results of both, they are sometimes wrong. we need to optimise and extend our own blame calculation to contain revision info
fields.summary: blame info is inconsistent with diffs
Proposal: have a (better) way to select text in source windows

fields.description: use the date that the frx checkbox was checked to find which from revision to use in the diff.
fields.summary: by default show only the latest revisions in an iterative review

fields.description: Include a checkbox for user to select/deselect to choose "remember me" on the login screen. This allow the user no need to key in the username and password all the time.
fields.summary: Include "Remember me" checkbox on the login screen

fields.description: BackupJob that runs from Quartz currently still invokes the old backup implementation and must be rewritten. At the same time we must remove the old backup mechanism completely.
fields.summary: Quartz backup job must invoke the new xml-based backup

fields.description:
The due date calendar popup lets the user specify a date and time for the review to expire. The timestamp string is formatted by the js Calendar code and doe not include a timezone. The server interprets this as local time (in the server's timezone), which leads to an incorrect time when the server and client are in different timezones:

If you're in California and the server's in Sydney and you set the due date in one hour, the (local) timestamp you specify will lie 18 hours in the past from the perspective of the server (which is 19 hours ahead on the client), so the review will instantly be over due.

I could fix this in the client side calendar by letting it include the (local) timezone, but our js calendar doesn't seem to support that (http://www.dynarch.com/static/jscalendar-1.0/doc/html/reference.html#node_sec_5.3.5)
fields.summary: Due date has local time conversion issue

fields.description:
We'd like to send a one-off msg to a mailing list (or individual users, either way works) when a new review is started.  This is to invite them to join the review if they're interested.  BUT -- we don't want to continue sending msg after msg to that address as comments are added to the review.

Is there any way to do this now?  If not, please add!  Thanks!

Currently we are not able to post comments (e.g. file revision comments) to some reviews on AtlasEye. E.g posting {code:xml} 2009-03-06T13:51:40.575+01:00 wseliga false false false true fsdfsd CFR-25687 {code} to AtlasEye (from Connector) results in: {code:xml} This is blocker as it blocks totally dogfooding of Eclipse and IntelliJ Connectors on AtlasEye How to reproduce: - open CR-BAM-183 on AtlasEye via Connector - try to add (Edwin has access to this review) a revision comment to any file (e.g. save as draft) - you will always get HTTP 500 Strangely enough I have no such issues with CR-ACC-1 on the same server
fields.summary: NPE in Crucible on posting review comment

fields.description:

response:
{code:xml}
...

			</permId>

			</fromPath>
			<fromRevision>28039</fromRevision>
			<repositoryName>connector-commons</repositoryName>
			<toContentUrl>
				/cru/CR-ACC-1/rawcontent/104350/trunk%2Fcom.atlassian.connector.commons%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2Fjava%2Fcom%2Fatlassian%2Ftheplugin%2Fcommons%2Fcrucible%2Fapi%2Fmodel%2Fnotification%2FReviewDifferenceProducer.java
			</toContentUrl>
			<toPath>
				trunk/com.atlassian.connector.commons/src/main/java/com/atlassian/theplugin/commons/crucible/api/model/notification/ReviewDifferenceProducer.java
			</toPath>
			<toRevision>28714</toRevision>
		</reviewItem>
...
{code}

I have a few issues with that:
# HTTP 404 for queries which are built by concatenating server URL with to/fromContentUrl. E.g.: https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/cru/CR-ACC-1/rawcontent/104037/trunk%2Fcom.atlassian.connector.commons%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2Fjava%2Fcom%2Fatlassian%2Ftheplugin%2Fcommons%2Fbamboo%2FBambooBuildAdapter.java fails with HTTP 404
# When I manually change %2F into "/" then everything works fine (e.g https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/cru/CR-ACC-1/rawcontent/104037/trunk/com.atlassian.connector.commons/src/main/java/com/atlassian/theplugin/commons/bamboo/BambooBuildAdapter.java)
# even stranger thing is that on Crucible 1.6.x (with latest Marek patch there) both requests (with and without %2F) work fine
# why these URI-s are URL-encoded? It would be enough if they were XML-encoded in XML REST response.
# Currently generated URL is smelly for me. I does not look like correct use of REST. URI-s of resources should be retrievable. Moreover they could include server part of URL also. They start with "/" but they are actually relative URL-s. What do you think?

Currently Connectors (Eclipse & IntelliJ) do not work with Crucible on AtlasEye due to this issue. I could manually decode %2F-s into "/", but I feel it would be a workaround rather than the proper fix.
fields.summary: Character escape problem + bad URLs in new <fromContentUrl> element in REST response for review details

fields.description:
If I do the following things:

* Create user "john" in crowd
* Call UserService.getUser("john")

The method will return null. This will cause big problems in JIRA Studio, which very often needs to access users in FishEye after they've been created but before they've logged in for the first time.
fields.summary: UserService does not find external users that haven't logged in before

fields.description: When a user add a revision of file into Crucible for a review, this file has been displayed in diff mode. However, its status is "ADDED", but not "MODIFIED".
fields.summary: A file is showing diff when its status is "ADDED"

fields.description: Take a look at sample XML response for an arbitrary review, when user tries to fetch data without any authentication. In case of public servers and malicious users, I don't think that exposing stack trace makes sense when we have "access denied". Now anonymous users know a lot of underlying stack (jetty, spring, jersey, etc.) and could theoretically use this knowledge to easier prepare an exploit. {code:xml} NotPermitted You do not have
